column4: i plugged my pc into my work network, i can see other machines but i cant get to the internet -- i cant ping google by name or ip -- any help is appreciated
check if you got a default gateway (route -n) and how far you get (tracepath www.google.com)
i do not have any gateway listed when i do sudo route
so your companys DHCP does not assign a gateway to you?  can be.... no gateway, no inet
i'm sure they'd be willing to assign me one, i just didn't get it
do you use dhcp for configuration, or did you assign an ip yourself?
i had to explicitly set my ip in order to ping anything.  i couldn't even see other machines until i did "sudo ifconifg eth0 inet 192..."
ah ok, then you need to set your router the like, just check the other boxes for their router (and dns)
router = gateway?
yep
and how do i set those explicitly? also with ifconfig?
first try : sudo dhclient eth0 - maybe there is a dhcp server running.
dns is set by "nameserver 1.2.3.4" in /etc/resolv.conf, router by "route add default gw 1.1.1.3"
i tried that before i set my ip, it didnt work
both can be controlled via /etc/network/interfaces for a more permanent setup
well, dont now how you tried before
just pick up the info at another box
thank you! setting everything explicitly did the trick
welcome
it's a pretty old laptop, but an ibm, not anything exotic

once you have a working one, be happy. onrmally you should never have any problem with it, unless you have hardware that just "does not work" (means: not supported by kernel). whatever, even after updating, you can chose to boot an older kernel in the boot menu, if the latest one should be broken for oyu
could be some problem with the network driver.... could... but who cares, it seems to be fixed :)
